title: [Large-Scale] Understanding Scientific Inquiry and Creative Thinking: Citizen Science Literacy Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science concepts and experience solving everyday problems
context.additional_context: Designs smartphone-based learning activities, utilizing science inquiry scenarios linked to everyday life.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the role of creativity in the nature of science.

Applying problem-based learning (PBL) methodology for two weeks, learners must select one real-world community issue (e.g., resource allocation inefficiency, program operational failures), then produce a 10-page report with actionable solutions following a five-step scientific problem-solving process (problem definition–hypothesis formation–data collection–solution derivation–evaluation). The report must meet at least 70% of the rubric criteria: problem definition clarity (20%), data collection appropriateness (20%), solution feasibility (30%), evaluation system validity (20%), and report completeness (10%).
Learners understand the connectivity between scientific concepts and apply creative approaches using advanced organizers.

During a mid-term course (3 weeks), learners must fulfill at least seven of ten formative assessment checklist items, then write a self-evaluation report including three specific improvement plans for unmet items.

resources: Three versions of NOS (Notation, Organization, Strategy) advance organizers
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
